intro: Thlaspi brachypetalum, commonly known as the narrow-petaled rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils, often found in alpine or arctic regions. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually basal, with a slightly succulent texture. It is adapted to cold climates and can survive in harsh environmental conditions. Thlaspi brachypetalum plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats and is sometimes cultivated as a ornamental plant.
